Description: Sandstone stela of Teucharis; four lines of Greek text above a rectangular hole and a cross with the alpha-omega monogram in the upper spaces. Description in Hall: Inscription above. Below this, in centre, a rectangular hole through the stela, immediately above a rectangular sunken panel bordered by zigzag and vine-leaf ornamentation. In the panel is a cross pattée with loop: in the upper spaces A and Ѡ, in the lower two pendent vine-leaves.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.134, Pl.95)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: I.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 95:3 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
